result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrick L Guider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
To be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds/ earnings.

Court set restitution at $0.

NOT ELIGIBLE for CIP OR SAP.
*April 3, 2017 Credit amended to 248 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No possession of firearms or ammunition.
Defendant may not reside in any residence where there are children under the age  of 16 years

Register/ comply with Sex-Offender Registry.
Comply with all rules as set forth by agent.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY from all illegal drugs and alcohol.
Provide prescriptions to agent before filling them.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: On Sept. 29, 2015:  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrick L Guider

records.addlTxt: Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Addendum to the PSI received and filed on 11/23/15. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court advised the defendant that upon a conviction of this offense he may be subject to Chapter 980 proceedings.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. Attorney Ritter requested to be present at the PSI interview. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Darrick L Guider not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing. Parties have received the DNA results and are still in negotiations. Defense counsel requested a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court retained this matter post-rotation. Case transferred back to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Discussion regarding the State's joinder motion. Defense counsel does not oppose the motion. Court granted the State's motion for joinder with defendant's other pending case 15CF2151 for reasons stated on the record. Defense counsel may be filing a motion for severance from COUNT 3 of case 15CF2151. Parties are still waiting for the DNA results and request an adjourned status date. Court will retain this matter post-rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Discussion regarding defendant's status of counsel in his other pending case 15CF2151. Case remains scheduled for motion hearing on 7/10/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Per the Court, this matter needs to be set on the calendar for a staus conference. Parties notified. Clerk notified the Sheriff's Department to produce the defendant. Case adjourned to 6/23/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Further Proceedings in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Case originally scheduled for 1:30 p.m., but was called on the record this morning with the defendant's other pending case (15CF2151). Clerk spoke to attorney Ritter via telephone prior to this case being called. Parties are still waiting for the DNA results and request an adjourned scheduling date. State filed a motion for joinder with defendant's other pending case. Defense reponse due on or before 6/22/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Join Cases received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Attorney Ritter has recently been retained on this matter and requests to substitute in as counsel of record. Court granted defense counsel's request. Parties made joint request for adjourned scheduling date pending the DNA results. Court granted joint request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court, in custody with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.T.H or S.H.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrick L Guider in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Darrick L Guider in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
